==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
[[File:Yuki_Shrine_-_giant_Sugi.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|神木}} (''shinboku'', ''kanki''): a '''{{l|en|sacred}} {{l|en|tree}}''' encircled with a ''{{w|shimenawa}}'' belt.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|しん|ぼく}}
Possibly from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しんぼく}} compound {{m|ltc|神木|tr={{IPAchar|/ʑiɪn muk̚/}}|lit=god + tree}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|min|-}} reading ''sîn-bo̍k''.  The Japanese term uses the [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]], suggesting a later borrowing.

Alternatively, may have been coined in Japan as a compound of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived elements, as {{m|ja|神|tr=shin||god, spirit}} + {{m|ja|木|tr=boku||tree}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|しんぼく|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しんぼく}}

# a {{l|en|sacred}} or {{l|en|holy}} {{l|en|tree}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{qualifier|honorific}} {{ja-r|御神木|ごしんぼく}}, {{ja-r|ご神木|ごしんぼく}}
* {{ja-r|神樹|しんじゅ}}
* {{ja-r|霊木|れいぼく}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かむ|k1=かん|き}}
{{IPAchar|/kamuki/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaɴki/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かんき}}.  Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かむき|神|tr1=kamu|t1=god, spirit|pos1=ancient combining reading|木|tr2=ki|t2=tree}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  Appears with the older ''kamuki'' phonetic rendering in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'' poetry compilation completed in 759 CE.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かんき}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かんき}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かんき|obsolete}} {{n-g|see </i>shinboku<i> above}}

=====Usage notes=====
Superseded by the ''shinboku'' reading above.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|さか|き}}
Alternative spelling of {{m|ja|榊|tr=sakaki}} as {{juku|sort=さかき}}, likely based on a partial decomposition of the {{m|ja|榊}} character into its {{m|ja|神}} and {{m|ja|木}} components.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|さかき|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さかき}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=さかき|rare}} the {{l|en|sakaki}} tree, {{taxlink|Cleyera japonica|species|noshow=1|ver=161128}}
